alert.note: Alert for Uvalde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kinney, northeastern Maverick, southwestern Uvalde and northwestern Zavala Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 859 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Dabney, or 18 miles southeast of Spofford, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anacacho and Dabney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central Texas.
